items.name: Daniel
items.headline: DELF B2 — passed on first try
items.text: Came three months before the exam: my writing was 12/25, I panicked during speaking. Every two weeks we did a "rehearsal," analyzed typical mistakes. Zhyldyz gave me a simple writing structure—intro → two arguments → conclusion—and we drilled it to automaticity. On exam day I was calm: writing came out 20/25, overall score passed the threshold. I spoke confidently for the first time, without escaping to English.

items.name: Alina
items.headline: Needed three points — got them in 8 weeks
items.text: My speaking was weak: I got lost and spoke too long. In lessons I spoke 70% of the time—short and structured: thesis → example → conclusion. A week before the date we did a full rehearsal, Zhyldyz showed where I "ate" endings and dragged pauses. On the exam I got a similar topic—gained +4 points and closed B2.

items.name: Marina
items.headline: Started speaking professionally without stress
items.text: Moved for an internship and was scared of calls. We practiced real-life scenes: call the bank, write a colleague, clarify at reception. Between lessons—small voice tasks 5–10 minutes, and Zhyldyz responded with corrections. After a month I handled issues at the office and on trips—calmly and without panic.

items.question: How many lessons per week?
items.answer: Typically 3×60-min lessons per week, but the schedule can be adjusted based on your availability and goals. We'll finalize the best cadence during your trial lesson.

items.question: Do you provide materials?
items.answer: Yes—curated, level-appropriate content plus original materials (incl. textbook co-authored by the tutor) and targeted drills.

items.question: Can you register me for exams?
items.answer: I prepare you and advise on dates/centers; you register and pay the exam center directly.

items.question: Will we only do speaking?
items.answer: Speaking is the core (70%), but every plan includes listening, reading, writing, and pronunciation—weighted to your goal (DELF/DALF or workplace needs).

items.question: Do you teach groups?
items.answer: Yes, group sessions are available. We'll discuss the best format for your goals during the trial lesson.

items.question: What's your background?
items.answer: DALF C2; official DELF-DALF & TEF examiner; former director at Alliance Française Bishkek; university + international school experience.
